noun.description: A thing or things belonging to someone; possessions collectively.
examples: she wanted Oliver and his property out of her house
the stolen property was not recovered

noun.description: An attribute, quality, or characteristic of something.
examples: the property of heat to expand metal at uniform rates

origin: Middle English: from an Anglo-Norman French variant of Old French propriete, from Latin proprietas, from proprius one's own, particular (see proper).
